snippet: Four million adults in the 22 states that did not expand Medicaid earn too much for that program but too little to receive federal subsidies for coverage.
abstract: Millions of Americans are forced to take on second and third jobs to escape gap in Affordable Care Act; low-income adults who live in states that have declined to expand Medicaid under health care law often earn too little money to receive federal aid for buying private health insurance and too much to qualify for Medicaid.
lead_paragraph: Four million adults in the 22 states that did not expand Medicaid earn too much for that program but too little to receive federal subsidies for coverage.

headline.main: Piling On Work to Escape Gap in Health Law
headline.print_headline: Piling on Work to Escape Gap in Health Law

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
